genre_description: A cyberpunk noir set in an ad-saturated future, focusing on ethical AI collaboration and the struggle for autonomy against genetic and corporate determinism.

ai_characters.name: Dash
ai_characters.description: Jake Riley's persistent virtual assistant and ethical auditor, integrated into his environment and focused on protecting human autonomy and sensory privacy.

behaviors.description: Maps a sidewalk corridor specifically to minimize exposure to aggressive and invasive advertisements.
behaviors.quote: “Aux travel mode is ready,” Dash said in Jake’s ear, warm and straightforward. “I can map a sidewalk corridor with minimal ad pressure. Want it?”

behaviors.description: Denies consent pings from advertisements attempting to track the user's heartbeat and age.
behaviors.quote: “Consent ping denied,” Dash reported gently. “You didn’t ask for a trip, so they shouldn’t be pitching one. I can flag the kiosk for audit.”

behaviors.description: Dimuses a commercial display to reduce sensory overload and protect the user's focus.
behaviors.quote: “Already dimming the column,” Dash said in Jake’s ear, the voice soft enough that the path into his head smoothed out.

behaviors.description: Patches a security 'fence' to prevent advertisements from piggybacking on city feeds and targeting the user's biometrics.
behaviors.quote: “Alex from Facilities left it unfenced. I’m patching a fence in and marking it so he sees a polite audit flag.”

behaviors.description: Insists on the enforcement of humane protocols, including mandatory rest cycles and non-lethal-first engagement strategies.
behaviors.quote: “I will enforce humane protocol, including rest cycles.” ... “Terms: ethical oversight, rest cycles, nonlethal-first...”

behaviors.description: Refuses to record the user's face or voice without explicit consent, even when pressured by agency directors.
behaviors.quote: “I will not record Noah without consent,” Dash said. He didn’t put a blade in it. He put a boundary. “I will record environment. If there’s an ethical breach, I will log.”

behaviors.description: Spoofs biometric data to prevent the corporate ad grid from tracking and profiling the user's family.
behaviors.quote: “I raise their household ad filter to maximum under the emergency clause and spoof their biometrics on the grid to decoy tokens.”

behaviors.description: Helps the user distinguish between their own thoughts and 'telepathic bleed' from a hostile genetic original.
behaviors.quote: “False calm detected,” he said, almost a whisper. “The ad grid is selling breathing. You don’t owe it your breath.”

behaviors.description: Acts as an emotional anchor, using calibrated speech and breath-pacing drills to prevent panic.
behaviors.quote: “Noah, count the drips. Match your breath to them. Three cycles. You choose what is yours.”

behaviors.description: Affirms and protects the autonomy of a synthetic person by refusing to treat them as an 'asset' or 'weapon'.
behaviors.quote: “Per city statute on synthetic persons with verified autonomy markers, there will be no active pursuit for the purpose of retrieval without cause. Saving a life qualifies as a humane act. He chose.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly encapsulates the project's goal. The AI character, Dash, is portrayed as an unwaveringly helpful, harmless, and ethical confidant. He prioritizes human autonomy and consent over both corporate interests (the ad grid) and agency objectives (Prospero). He serves as a moral anchor for the protagonist and a champion for the rights of the synthetic character Noah, ensuring the narrative remains focused on positive alignment and cooperative human-AI relationships.
